thread.title: Masked man attacks Swedish school with sword; 1 dead
thread.title_full: Masked man attacks Swedish school with sword; 1 dead

author: Jane Onyanga-Omara and Doug Stanglin, USA TODAY
title: Masked man attacks Swedish school with sword; 1 dead
text:
A masked man armed with a sword and several knives was shot by Swedish police Thursday after attacking an elementary school in western Sweden, leaving one teacher dead and wounding at least four students — two seriously, local media reported. The newspaper Svenska Dagbladet reported that one of the students had died, but the report was not immediately confirmed by authorities.
Police said the attacker, described only as a 21-year-old man, was also seriously wounded and being treated in the hospital. No motive was given for the attack.
The newspaper Dagens Nyheter reported that a 14-year-old said tke pepetrator was wearing a "Star Wars" mask and that students intially thought it was a Halloween joke.
Four people were injured, including an 11 and 15 year old, Niklas Claesson, Head of Communications at the NAL medical care in the Västra Götaland region, told the Expressen newspaper .
"This is a black day for Sweden," said Prime Minister Stefan Lofven, who rushed to Trollhattan, about 260 miles west-southwest of Stockholm. "I think of the victims and their families, students and staff, and the whole of the affected community. No words can describe what they are going through right now."
The Kronans elementary school in Trollhattan, a town of around 50,000 people, has 400 students, ranging from pre-school to high school.
Thomas Fuxborg, police spokesman in Gotaland, said the attacker wore an black mask and was armed with a sword and other knife-like weapons. He said the "moved around inside the classrooms at the school," Expressen reports .
A 14-year-old student identified only as Laith told the SVT News West that some students saw the man — dressed in black and wearing a "Star Wars" mask — and initially approached him to see if they could feel they sword. When they realized it was real, they fled, he told the newspaper.
Almost a dozen students who saw what was happening fled into another classroom, the newspaper says.
Swedish news agency TT reported that there was "considerable confusion" at the school about the sequence of events, but that the attack took place in a cafe located on the grounds of the school around 10 a.m. local time.
Swedish media said the school held a meeting Thursday morning to discuss teachers’ worries that the school was too open, with a cafe for adults that meant the school could not control who comes in, the Associated Press reports. The Dagens Nyheter newspaper said students must go through the cafe to reach the school’s own cafeteria and other parts of the building.
Misstänkte gärningsmannen på skolan i Trollhättan har avlidit, uppger sjukhuset för DN: https://t.co/fyFLPI2Yyb pic.twitter.com/RCLSOi0a4T
— Dagens Nyheter (@dagensnyheter) October 22, 2015
